temperature returns again to its former

27. The essentially different character of the 
two extremities of the first spectrum 
of Nitrogen as described (16-19) and the 
indistinctness of its middle part suggested 
to us the idea, that in reality the observed 
spectrum might originate from the super 
position of two single spectra. Accordingly 
one of these single spectra, the more refrac 
ted part of which is best developed, must 
be formed by channeled spaces; the other the 
the less refracted part of which is best 
developed, must be a spectrum of shadow[y?]
bands. In different cases either the one 
or the other of the spectra may be pre 
dominant.
In order to confirm our conjectures it 
was necessary to get both spectra separated.
28. The discharge of Ruhmkorff’s coil through 
a spectral tube is changed the less by intro
ducing the Leyden jar, <s>as the tension of<\s> the weaker is the resistence 
<s>the gas within <\s> opposed to it by the tube. <s>is weaker<\s>. Accor 
dingly the two different degrees of tem 
perature to which the gas rises by the 
discharge when, the coil remaining the 
same, may be regulated in such a way 
as to approach one another more and [more?].
Let the tension of the gas of about 10mm
